qas.question: How many manufacturing workers does Paris have?
What does Paris region manufacturing specialize in?
How much of a drop was there in manufacturing jobs between 1990 and 2010?
How many people does the Paris regions aerospace companies employ?
The closing of what plant in 20147 caused a major loss to the automobile industry?

context: Paris' manufacturing is mostly focused in its suburbs, and the city itself has only around <a0_0>75,000<a0_0/> manufacturing workers, most of which are in the textile, clothing, leather goods and shoe trades. Paris region manufacturing specialises in <a1_0>transportation<a1_0/>, mainly automobiles, aircraft and trains, but this is in a sharp decline: Paris proper manufacturing jobs dropped by <a2_0>64<a2_0/> percent between 1990 and 2010, and the Paris region lost 48 percent during the same period. Most of this is due to companies relocating outside the Paris region. The Paris region's 800 aerospace companies employed <a3_0>100,000<a3_0/>. Four hundred automobile industry companies employ another 100,000 workers: many of these are centred in the Yvelines department around the Renault and PSA-Citroen plants (this department alone employs 33,000), but the industry as a whole suffered a major loss with the 2014 closing of a major <a4_0>Aulnay-sous-Bois Citroen<a4_0/> assembly plant.
